meanings.definition: To soak flax or hemp in water to soften it for processing.
meanings.sent1: I will ret the flax before spinning it into linen.
meanings.sent2: The farmer decided to ret the hemp fibers before weaving them into fabric.
meanings.sent3: The flax was so stubborn, it needed a good ret to become pliable.
meanings.sent4: The water worked its magic as it began to ret the tough fibers into something usable.
meanings.sent5: The retting process transformed the stiff flax into a flexible material.

meanings.sent1: Please do not ret the delivery any longer; we need it urgently.
meanings.sent2: The teacher had to ret the test results due to a technical issue.
meanings.sent3: The bus driver decided to ret the departure just to annoy the passengers.
meanings.sent4: Her fear of failure often caused her to ret taking risks in life.
meanings.sent5: The decision to ret the project launch led to missed opportunities.

meanings.sent1: Please write 'ret' on the package for easy identification.
meanings.sent2: The form requires your signature for ret of the item.
meanings.sent3: The 'ret' on the document indicated the sender's address.
meanings.sent4: The 'ret' on the label helped the package find its way back home.
meanings.sent5: The 'ret' on the receipt allowed for a hassle-free exchange.
